result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter C Schwarz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs to avoid serving jail time.

Stayed. If defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 11/29/16, stay will be permanent. If defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 11/29/16, stay will be lifted and defendant will need to report to jail. Good time and huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hunter C Schwarz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Hunter C Schwarz in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant appears on his own at 3:00 pm.

Defendant Hunter C Schwarz in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, cancels warrant. Court indicates scheduled trial has bee removed from the calendar. Court reviews added charge in amended complaint along with max. penalties. Defense waives reading of the amended complaint, enters not guilty plea to added charge. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Maciolek requests a status date. Court questions defendant on missed court appearance. Atty Maciolek advises that it looks like defendant didn't receive notice of pretrial and trial dates. Court address bond. State requests cash bond. Court won't change bond, remains in effect as previously set.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Email from JA Ripp to Atty Gerbers indicating court is removing 8/31/16 jury trial from the calendar.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gerbers not sure where defendant is at, he's usually in court for all hearings. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant but stays signing it until 4:00 pm Tuesday, 8/16/16 to allow Atty Gerbers time to locate defendant and make other arrangements for him to appear.
Motion and Order Amending Criminal Complaint
Jury trial on August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Defendant is now working for Door County Kayak Tours and Junipers Gin Joint

Defendant Hunter C Schwarz appears by phone along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial.  Matter will be set for pretrial and trial. Court questions defendant on current address/employment. Court advises defendant he needs to appear in person for next court hearing. Bond remains in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Hunter C Schwarz
Current: 994 Cottage Road, Ellison Bay, WI 54210 United States  (Effective: 06-02-2016)
Prior: 7697 Chapel Ln, Baileys Harbor, WI 54202

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Hunter C Schwarz in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
